titleInfo.title: Ext 2013/45 'Saudi Arabia: Post War Petroleum situation'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 8; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains an account by George Ogilvie-Forbes, British Ambassador to Venezuela, of a conversation with Arthur A Curtice, an American petroleum engineer advising the Government of Venezuela. The account details comparisons made by Curtice between the petroleum resources of South America and the Middle East.The file also contains correspondence regarding an upcoming visit to Saudi Arabia by Curtice and Herbert Hoover Jr, founder of the oil company United Geophysical and an adviser to the Government of Persia. The primary correspondents are Ogilvie-Forbes and the Foreign Office.
